result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanisha Marie Saxton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 11.3.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered. No DNA surcharge ordered.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tanisha Marie Saxton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 8/7/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.  at

Defendant Tanisha Marie Saxton in court with attorney Joshua Davis Uller.  Hanna Kolberg for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for jury trial. On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Carrying a Concealed Weapon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.23 (2), a Misdemenanor. Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.    

Statements made as to sentencing. Additional statements by Lamarray C. 
Defendant ordered to serve 5 days in the House of Correction with credit of 5 days time served.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 11.3.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.
No DNA surcharge ordered. 

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Tanisha Marie Saxton in court with attorney Joshua D. Uller.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is reassigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07 due to the Assignment of the Assistant District and the charges in this complaint.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
